summary: This is an email chain from April 3, 2019, between individuals, including an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York, scheduling a brief, non-emergency meeting to discuss an update on the Epstein case. The email indicates the preparation of a search warrant (SW).

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email requesting a 5-10 minute meeting to run a few things by colleagues regarding an Epstein update. Works in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Epstein Case Update Meeting Scheduled
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney schedules a brief meeting with colleagues to discuss updates on the Epstein case, mentioning the preparation of a search warrant.

keyFacts: The communication is dated April 3, 2019, after Epstein's 2019 arrest but before his death.
An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the SDNY is actively working on the Epstein case and seeking to coordinate with colleagues.
The email mentions the preparation of a search warrant (SW) in relation to the Epstein investigation.
The tone suggests ongoing, non-emergency investigative activity regarding Epstein.
